page.title: 05Rural Crafts in Debenham.
page.content: As saddler and harness maker,Mr L.Aldous is engaged in one of the oldest crafts. These rural crafts nearly died out some 25 years ago,but now the national interest in equine sports and driving provides more work than the firm can undertake.Most of the work is done by hand in the traditional manner.The quality of leather and craftsmanship is such that orders are given by firms hundreds of miles away from Debenham. Reed and osier fences are made by Mr C.Balch.He cuts reeds for his work on a contract basis from fens and meres in Suffolk and Norfolk,but most of the willow used in his work is grown on his farm at Derrybrook or on rented land in Winston.Reed and osier fences are made up into panels and osier fences are made on site.Mr Balch also makes garden shelters and sheds from willow.
